content.description:
Start with a right hand on the arete and through to a poor left-hand sloper.  Continue up the arete using toe hooks and some awkward slopers (crown these) for your right hand.

(Rated V6 in the Urban Rock guidebook, but this is incorrect. Solid V4 and easier than Masters of Reality.)
content.location: North side of Split Rock.  While facing the "split", problem runs along the left boulder, right arete.

content.description: A tricky start leads up into the awkard leaning corner, small pinscars allow a fairly burly lieback with tenuous feet to the finishing holds.
content.protection: Top-rope, long slings to the ground and a couple of small nuts. OR boulder problem at V1R.
content.location: Pin-scarred dihedral left of Johnson Problem.

content.description:
The undercut south face overhanging roof problem...Big moves to weird slopey funkness and again to the lip at an incut but rounded crimp. A big span move to and from the left arete and then forget about where your feet are, as you lurch and do a powerful rock-up to funky edges. Do a stand up move and slab it over slightly dicey terrain to the top.

For those Coloradoans, its like a harder version of Germ Free Adolescence to the lip but then it gets really ugly!! Watch out if one of the holds above the lip blows!
content.protection: Pads and spotters would be nice!!
content.location: South face of Split Rock. Right of the chimney. Just right of the Corner Problem on the BIG south face.

content.description: Very clear compression line on an unattached boulder just to the right of Darkside/Vaino. Obvious hands and feet all the way up. Technical footwork/commitment required up top.
content.location: On the obvious giant boulder with the huge crack down the middle. If you're walking the trail South from Turlock area you can see it from the trail on the left. Johnson/Vaino/Darkside are all on the opposite side of the boulder that you can see from the trail. You get to them by either scrambling over some boulders directly left of the giant crack or by walking south on the trail just a bit past Powerglide and then taking a faint trail left off the main trail and around to the Johnson Arete area.

content.description: Start low and head up the left side then traverse over (crux) and finish up the right arete as with Vaino Problem.
content.location: North side of Split Rock, left of Vaino Problem.

content.description:
Up and over the chockstone into the middle, now just start chimneying - it's fun and a little scary if soloing.

Descend down the short face on the West side.
